title: Boris Johnson vote news live: Latest Brexit updates as PM tries to pass EU deal
text:
Boris Johnson is facing a knife-edge vote on his Brexit deal as MPs sit on a Saturday for the first time since the Falklands War. The PM is struggling to find the 320 votes he needs, but some hardline Brexiteers and rebel Labour MPs indicated they would back it.

However the final decision could be derailed by a last-minute amendment from Oliver Letwin which – if backed – will push the “meaningful vote” back and force Mr Johnson to ask the EU for an extension to Brexit – the deadline for which is 11pm tonight.

No 10 intends on urging Tory MPs to boycott the Brexit deal vote if the Letwin amendment passes. Meanwhile, hundreds of thousands of people are set to take to the streets of London to demand a Final Say referendum.
